Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the tripartite test for a stay of removal
Application_Facts: Paul failed to present new evidence or show irreparable harm; Grenada was actively addressing domestic violence; her H&C application could proceed post-removal
Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed; removal proceeded as scheduled
Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed the motion for a stay of removal due to lack of serious issue and irreparable harm
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk from domestic violence in Grenada
Legal_Standard: A stay requires a serious issue, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience favoring the applicant
Assessment_Factor: Seriousness of the issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Procedural_Issue: Motion for stay of removal heard in Federal Court
Application_Basis: Refugee protection concerns based on domestic violence
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of new evidence, insufficient demonstration of state inability to protect
Relief_Sought: Stay of removal to prevent deportation
Governing_Rule: Applicant must provide clear evidence of state inability to protect
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to present new evidence or demonstrate irreparable harm
Cause_Description: Paul sought to prevent her deportation to Grenada, claiming risk from domestic violence
Evidence_Handling: Existing evidence reviewed; no new evidence submitted
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish risk or state failure
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence found inadequate to support stay
Decision_Rationale: No serious issue or irreparable harm established
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of new and compelling evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Tripartite test for stay of removal
